newsitem.title: USA: Houghton Mifflin cuts INSO stake.
newsitem.headline: Houghton Mifflin cuts INSO stake.

text.p: Houghton Mifflin Co said Tuesday it reduced its stake in INSO Corp to 29.6 percent or 3,877,600 common shares.
In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Houghton Mifflin said it sold 137,500 shares of INSO between Aug 7 and Oct 18. It did not disclose how much it received for the shares sold.
Houghton Mifflin, which previously held a 30.7 percent stake in INSO, said it intends to periodically review its investment in the Boston-based provider of multilingual software products.
Depending on its future evaluation, it said it may determine to increase or decrease its stake in the company, Houghton Mifflin said.
Houghton Mifflin, which is also based in Boston, is a textbook publisher.
